pullRequest.title: [miio]  Add Xiaomi cloud logon (token download) and map download
pullRequest.bodyText:
[miio] WIP cloudlogon to get device tokens and map
[miio] save server responses
[miio] cloudstuff cleanup
[miio] Cloud - more updates map download
[miio] WIP get vacuum map from cloud
[miio] WIP get tokens from cloud
[miio] WIP output vacuum image
[miio] first working  version with map and tokens from cloud
[miio] improvements map downloads
[miio] improve map decoding
[miio] finalized map drawing logic
[miio] 2nd alpha version cloud+map funcionality
[miio] fixing spotbugs issues
[miio] more spot bug issues resolving
[miio] improved map reading
[miio] map version 1.1
[miio] cleanup many notnullbydefault issues alpha release3
[miio] cleaning cloudconnector
[miio] alpha release 3
[mio] cached logons
[miio] small cleanup
[miio] minor fix text drawing
[miio] alpha 4
[miio] new models added
[miio] Improve path color
[miio] generic county request
[miio] mapviewer cleanup
[miio] log levels adjustment
[miio] update readme
Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen marcel@verpaalen.com

nodes.bodyText: Why does this need the NonNullByDefault annotation? It is already non-null.
Instead of a singleton instance I would prefer you make this an OSGI component instead.
please remove this blank line.
Make sure to include the cause exception.
Make sure to include the cause exception
Please catch specific exceptions.
Can this be made private?
remove blank line

this one too.
blank line
see other comment
I think TimesRoman is a Microsoft licensed font, and may not be available on all systems. Is there another font you can use instead?
Not even going to log this?
blank line
There is a lot of string concatenation going on, can you use a StringBuilder instead?
checking trace enabled but logging as info?

include cause exception
include cause exception
use or lose
use or lose
Always returns empty string?
Why are you forcing the locale to UK?
Please use a multicatch
can most of these fields be made final?
Please put static variables above the constructors

commit.message:
[miio] fix updating basic devices (#7254)

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>

[miio] improvements based on feedback

* feedback improvements
* token obfuscation for log sharing
* basic handler cleanup and improvements

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>

commit.message:
[miio] schedule login to avoid activation issues

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>

nodes.bodyText: remove
SimpleDateFormat instance should be static to allow for reuse.
Why not save the configuration as a local field during initialization so that you don't need to recreated it every time this method is called?
why not make ConfigConstants.getUserDataFolder() + File.separator + BINDING_ID + File.separator a constant?
This code is fragile with regards to tokenText. If your original tokenText is too small everything breaks.

Instead of a StringBuilder, perhaps it would be better to use a StringWriter wrapped in a PrintWriter. That way you could use println and printf which would really make this code more readable and performant.
Then again this code isn't all that critical so I'm ok with you not changing it if it is too much work.
It is possible to process the file as a stream or is there a bunch of random-access going on?
Can you make these constants so that the code is a bit easier to understand?
Can this be made final?
Shouldn't the timezone be the local timezone, or no?
Doesn't this change? Why is this constant?

Instead of dealing with JsonElement, wouldn't it be better to parse json into a DTO instead?
Edit: This is more of a suggestion than a requirement, feel free to refuse.
You are still using TimesRoman here.

commit.message:
[miio] updates based on feedback

Fix for re-logon
move to DTO
Updates based on review feedback

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/2.5.x' into miio-cloudconnect

Conflicts:
	bundles/org.openhab.binding.miio/README.md
	bundles/org.openhab.binding.miio/src/main/java/org/openhab/binding/miio/internal/discovery/MiIoDiscovery.java

[miio] update readme & small cleanup

Signed-off-by: Marcel Verpaalen <marcel@verpaalen.com>

nodes.bodyText: Some of our build tools don't like EOF without a newline. So add a newline here.
You need two pings to go online?
Why do you need to logon here? Can it be done lazily?
might be cleaner if you made all these fields public, you could get rid of all the bloat of your getter methods.
Since you switched to DTOs, is this still used?
The default charset varies from system to system so it is better to specify it yourself instead of using the default.

Please put each sentence on a separate line. It makes it easier see changes.

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            The binding can retrieve the needed tokens from the Xiaomi cloud. Go to the binding config page and enter your cloud username and password. The server(s) to which your devices are connected need to be entered as well. Use the one of the regional servers: ru,us,tw,sg,cn,de. Multiple servers can be separated with comma, or leave blank to test all known servers.
          
          
            
            The binding can retrieve the needed tokens from the Xiaomi cloud. Go to the binding config page and enter your cloud username and password. The server(s) to which your devices are connected need to be entered as well. Use one of the regional servers: ru,us,tw,sg,cn,de. Multiple servers can be separated with comma, or leave blank to test all known servers.

nodes.bodyText: same changes here
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -16,6 +16,58 @@ The following things types are available:
 | miio:basic       | For several basic devices like yeelights, airpurifiers. Channels and commands are determined by database configuration   |
 | miio:unsupported | For experimenting with other devices which use the Mi IO protocol                                                        |
 
+# Discovery
+
+The binding has 2 methods for discovering devices. Depending on your network setup and the device model, your device may be discovered by one or both methods. If both methods discover your device, 2 discovery results may be in your inbox for the same device.
+
+The mDNS discovery method will discover your device type, but will not discover a (required) token.
+The basic discovery will not discovery the type, but will discover a token for models that support it.
+Accept only one of the 2 discovery results, the alternate one can further be ignored.
+
+## Tokens
+
+The binding needs a token from the Xiaomi Mi Device in order to be able to control it.
+The binding can retrieve the needed tokens from the Xiaomi cloud. Go to the binding config page and enter your cloud username and password. The server(s) to which your devices are connected need to be entered as well. Use the one of the regional servers: ru,us,tw,sg,cn,de. Multiple servers can be separated with comma, or leave blank to test all known servers.

nodes.bodyText: Can you make this an enum instead?
